subject: Personal Finance
title: The 1970s Stagflation
description: A short lesson to help you apply The 1970s Stagflation.

hook.text: Inflation hit 14%. Unemployment hit 9%. Economists said both couldn't happen at once. They were wrong.

buildup.text: Stagflation â€” stagnant growth plus high inflation â€” struck the US in the 1970s.

discovery.text: Oil embargoes by OPEC quadrupled energy prices. The cost of everything rose while the economy slowed.

twist.text: Traditional economics said to fight inflation, accept unemployment, or vice versa. Stagflation broke the model.

climax.text: Fed Chair Paul Volcker raised interest rates to 20% in 1981, causing a brutal recession but killing inflation.

punchline.text: Sometimes the cure hurts worse than the disease.

quiz.question: What is stagflation?
options: High inflation combined with stagnant economic growth
Rapid economic growth with low inflation
